subject: Fashion
title: Women Wearing Trousers Scandal
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Women Wearing Trousers Scandal.

hook.text: In 1966, Yves Saint Laurent put women in tuxedos. Restaurants refused to seat them.

buildup.text: Women in trousers had been controversial for over a century. Laws in many cities banned it.

discovery.text: During World War II, women wore pants in factories. When the war ended, they were told to stop.

twist.text: It wasn't until 1993 that U.S. Senate rules allowed women senators to wear trousers on the floor.

climax.text: A garment with two legs instead of one opening took 150 years to stop being a political statement.

punchline.text: Women earned the vote before they earned trousers.

quiz.question: When were women first allowed to wear trousers on the U.S. Senate floor?
options: 1966, after Yves Saint Laurent's tuxedo collection
1993, when the Senate dress code was finally updated
1945, after women's factory work during World War II
